TITLE: Query Batch Payload Structure (JSON)
DESCRIPTION: Defines the JSON structure for the payload of a querybatch request. The "queries" array contains objects, each representing a query by commit, version, or package information. The "page_token" is used for pagination.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/docs/api/post-v1-querybatch.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
  "queries": [
    {
      "commit": "string",
      "version": "string",
      "package": {
        "name": "string",
        "ecosystem": "string",
        "purl": "string"
      },
      "page_token": "string"
    },
    {
      "commit": "string",
      "version": "string",
      "package": {
        "name": "string",
        "ecosystem": "string",
        "purl": "string"
      },
      "page_token": "string"
    }
  ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: OSV Vulnerability Data Example
DESCRIPTION: This snippet presents a JSON object representing a vulnerability entry in the OSV database. It includes information about affected versions, aliases, database-specific details, vulnerability details, the affected ecosystem, fix information, external references, related vulnerabilities, search indices for efficient querying, severity levels, the data source, status, a brief summary, relevant timestamps, upstream raw data related to the vulnerability, and the withdrawal status. It shows the structure and types of data stored in each field.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/workers/worker/testdata/UpdateTest_dont_index_too_many_git_versions.txt#_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
    'affected': [{'ecosystem_specific': None,
                  'package': {'ecosystem': 'GIT',
                              'name': 'pkg',
                              'purl': 'pkg:git/repo/url'},
                  'ranges': [{'events': [{'introduced': '04970'}, {'fixed': '05000'}],
                              'repo': 'https://osv-test/repo/url',
                              'type': 'GIT'}],
                  'versions': ['04971',

    'aliases': [],

    'db_id': 'OSV-TEST-last-affected-01',
    'details': 'Blah blah blah\nBlah\n',
    'ecosystem': ['GIT'],

    'import_last_modified': DatetimeWithNanoseconds(2022, 10, 7, 18, 59),
```

TITLE: OSV-Scanner Fix Command (Relock Strategy)
DESCRIPTION: This command runs OSV-Scanner in non-interactive mode with the 'relock' strategy.  It aims to install the most up-to-date versions of dependencies and upgrade direct requirements to remove vulnerable packages. The '-M' flag specifies the path to the package.json file, and the '-L' flag specifies the path to the package-lock.json file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/website/blog/content/posts/announcing-guided-remediation-in-osv-scanner/index.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
osv-scanner fix --non-interactive --strategy=relock -M path/to/package.json -L path/to/package-lock.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: OSV-Scanner Fix Command (Interactive Mode)
DESCRIPTION: This command runs OSV-Scanner in interactive mode, providing finer control over the remediation process. The '-M' flag specifies the path to the package.json file, and the '-L' flag specifies the path to the package-lock.json file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/website/blog/content/posts/announcing-guided-remediation-in-osv-scanner/index.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
osv-scanner fix -M path/to/package.json -L path/to/package-lock.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Query Vulnerability by Commit Hash (OSV API)
DESCRIPTION: This command queries the OSV API for vulnerabilities associated with a specific commit hash.  It sends a JSON payload containing the commit hash to the `/v1/query` endpoint.  The API returns a JSON response containing any vulnerabilities found for that commit.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/docs/api/api-quickstart.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -d '{"commit": "6879efc2c1596d11a6a6ad296f80063b558d5e0f"}' \
    "https://api.osv.dev/v1/query"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Query Vulnerabilities by Package Version (OSV API)
DESCRIPTION: This command queries the OSV API for vulnerabilities associated with a specific package name, version and ecosystem. It sends a JSON payload containing the package name, version, and ecosystem to the `/v1/query` endpoint. The API returns a JSON response containing any vulnerabilities found for that package version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/docs/api/api-quickstart.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -d \
          '{"version": "2.4.1", "package": {"name": "jinja2", "ecosystem": "PyPI"}}' \
          "https://api.osv.dev/v1/query"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: determineversion API Response example
DESCRIPTION: Example of the JSON response returned by the /v1experimental/determineversion API endpoint.  It provides an array of potential library matches, ranked by score, along with repository information, number of matching files, and estimated number of different files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/docs/api/post-v1-determineversion.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
  "matches": [
    {
      "score": 0.5, // float between 0.0 - 1.0
      "repo_info": {
        "type": "string", // e.g. GIT
        "address": "string", // Repo Address
        "tag": "string", // Git tag
        "version": "string" // Library version
      },
      "minimum_file_matches": "string", // Number of exact hash matches
      "estimated_diff_files": "string" // Estimated number of different files
    }
  ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Scanning a directory with OSV-Scanner (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to run OSV-Scanner to scan a directory for Maven dependencies and their transitive dependencies. The `-r` flag specifies the directory path to be scanned. It searches for `pom.xml` files within the specified directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/website/blog/content/posts/announcing-transitive-dependency-support-for-maven-pomxml-in-osv-scanner/index.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
osv-scanner -r path/to/your/directory
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Scanning Container Images with OSV-Scanner (v2)
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to scan a container image using the `osv-scanner scan image` command. It utilizes the new layer-aware container scanning support, providing details on package introduction layers, base images, and OS distribution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/website/blog/content/posts/osv-scanner-v2-beta1-is-ready/index.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
osv-scanner scan image <image-name>:<tag>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running OSV-Scanner with Allowed Licenses
DESCRIPTION: This command executes the OSV-Scanner with the experimental licenses flag, specifying a comma-separated list of allowed SPDX licenses. The scanner will then show a detailed view of each package that has a license outside of the allowed license set in the specified directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/website/blog/content/posts/introducing-license-scanning-with-osv-scanner/index.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
osv-scanner \
  --experimental-licenses='<comma-separated list of allowed spdx licenses>' \
  path/to/directory
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Scanning a pom.xml file with OSV-Scanner (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This command shows how to run OSV-Scanner to scan a specific `pom.xml` file for Maven dependencies. The `-L` flag specifies the path to the `pom.xml` file. This will identify both direct and transitive dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/website/blog/content/posts/announcing-transitive-dependency-support-for-maven-pomxml-in-osv-scanner/index.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
osv-scanner -L path/to/your/pom.xml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Regenerate Protobufs with grpc_tools.protoc
DESCRIPTION: This command regenerates protobuf files using the grpc_tools.protoc compiler. It specifies include paths, output paths for descriptor sets, python code, gRPC python code, and mypy stubs, along with the input protobuf file (osv_service_v1.proto). This ensures that the generated code reflects the latest API definitions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/api/v1/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
python3 -m grpc_tools.protoc \
    --include_imports \
    --include_source_info \
    --proto_path=googleapis \
    --proto_path=. \
    --proto_path=.. \
    --descriptor_set_out=api_descriptor.pb \
    --python_out=../. \
    --grpc_python_out=../ \
    --mypy_out=../ \
    osv_service_v1.proto
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Scanning a pom.xml file with OSV-Scanner with relative path (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This command provides another variation of scanning a `pom.xml` file, where `pom.xml` is provided without a full path and the specific file is provided with a relative path. This demonstrates how to provide the path to the project being scanned.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/website/blog/content/posts/announcing-transitive-dependency-support-for-maven-pomxml-in-osv-scanner/index.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
osv-scanner -L pom.xml:path/to/your/file
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Guided Remediation for Maven pom.xml
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates the basic usage of guided remediation for Maven pom.xml files in non-interactive mode using OSV-Scanner. It applies the `override` strategy to remediate vulnerabilities by updating versions in the pom.xml file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/website/blog/content/posts/osv-scanner-v2-beta1-is-ready/index.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
osv-scanner fix --non-interactive --strategy=override -M path/to/pom.xml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Query Batch Request Sample (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a sample request to the /v1/querybatch endpoint using curl. The request includes queries for a specific package version (mlflow), a commit hash, and a package with name, ecosystem and version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/docs/api/post-v1-querybatch.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
cat <<EOF | curl -d @- "https://api.osv.dev/v1/querybatch"
{
  "queries": [
    {
      "package": {
        "purl": "pkg:pypi/mlflow@0.4.0"
      }
    },
    {
      "commit": "6879efc2c1596d11a6a6ad296f80063b558d5e0f"
    },
    {
      "package": {
        "ecosystem": "PyPI",
        "name": "jinja2"
      },
      "version": "2.4.1"
    }
  ]
}
EOF
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Vulnerability Listing JSON Format
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet demonstrates the required format for listing available vulnerabilities via a GET endpoint.  It lists the vulnerability ID and last modified date.  The 'id' field represents the OSV vulnerability ID, and the 'modified' field contains the timestamp of the last modification.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/website/blog/content/posts/announcing-curl-via-rest.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
[{
    "id": "OSV-CVE-2020-1111",
    "modified": "2023-12-04T10:12:08.00Z"
}, {
    "id": "OSV-CVE-2020-1112",
    "modified": "2023-12-04T10:16:25.00Z"
}]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Query OSV API for Vulnerabilities - Bash
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to query the OSV API for vulnerabilities affecting a specific package version in a given Linux distribution. It uses `curl` to send a POST request to the `/v1/query` endpoint with a JSON payload containing the package name, ecosystem (Linux distribution), and version. The API returns vulnerability information, if any.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/website/blog/content/posts/announcing-api-queries-for-more-linux-distros/index.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -d \
'{"package": {"name": "nodejs", "ecosystem": "AlmaLinux"},
"version": "1:16.13.1-3.module_el8.5.0+2605+45d748af"}' \
https://api.osv.dev/v1/query
```

TITLE: Retrieving Conversion Metrics with gcloud and jq
DESCRIPTION: This shell script uses `gcloud` to read logging entries related to the nvd-cve-osv conversion process. It then uses `jq` to extract the JSON payload from the logs and removes newline characters. Finally, `awk` is used to parse the relevant metrics from the log data, calculating the conversion success rate per year. The script requires the user to have the Logs Viewer and Service Usage Consumer IAM roles.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/vulnfeeds/cmd/nvd-cve-osv/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ gcloud --project oss-vdb logging read --freshness=12h --format=json 'logName="projects/oss-vdb/logs/nvd-cve-osv" "Metrics:"' | jq -r '. | map(.textPayload | gsub("[\\n]"; "")) | .[]' | awk '{ 
  match($1, /nvdcve-2\.0-(....)\.json/, year);
  match($5, /CVEsForKnownRepos:([0-9]+)/, cves_in_scope);
  match($6, /OSVRecordsGenerated:([0-9]+)/, osvs);
  print year[1], 100*osvs[1]/cves_in_scope[1]
}' | tail -n $[$(date +%Y) - 2016 + 1]
```

TITLE: Running API Server Tests with Long Tests Enabled
DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets the `LONG_TESTS` environment variable to `1` and then runs the API server tests using `make`. This enables the execution of tests that are typically skipped due to their longer execution time.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
LONG_TESTS=1 make api-server-tests
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: False Positives YAML Format
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet shows the format for specifying false positives (incorrect CVE to package matches) in the `false_positives.yaml` file. It includes lists of CVE IDs and package names along with optional justifications. This file is used by the vulnerability scanning tools to filter out false matches.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/vulnfeeds/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
ids:
- CVE-2021-1337  # justification
- CVE-2021-1338  # justification
packages:
- blah # justification
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: YAML Vulnerability Definition
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet defines a vulnerability entry for OSV. It includes details like the ID, summary, affected package, commit ranges, references, and CVSS score, specifying the vulnerability and affected versions of the `file` utility. The `database_specific` fields contain custom data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/workers/importer/testdata/ImporterTest_diff_basic.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
id: OSV-2017-134
summary: Heap-buffer-overflow in cdf_file_property_info
details: |+
  OSS-Fuzz report: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=1064

  Crash type: Heap-buffer-overflow READ 1
  Crash state:
  cdf_file_property_info
  cdf_file_summary_info
  cdf_check_summary_info
modified: '2021-01-01T00:00:00Z'
published: '2021-01-15T00:00:24.559102Z'
database_specific:
  database_specific: 1337.0
references:
- type: REPORT
  url: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=1064
affected:
- package:
    name: file
    ecosystem: OSS-Fuzz
    purl: pkg:generic/file
  ranges:
  - type: GIT
    repo: https://github.com/file/file.git
    events:
    - introduced: 17ee4cf670c363de8d2ea4a4897d7a699837873f
    - fixed: 19ccebafb7663c422c714e0c67fa4775abf91c43
  versions:
  - FILE5_29
  - FILE5_30
  ecosystem_specific:
    severity: MEDIUM
  database_specific:
    database_specific: 1337.0
schema_version: 1.6.0
severity:
- type: CVSS_V3
  score: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L
credits:
- name: Foo bar
- name: Bar foo
  contact:
  - mailto:bar@foo.com
```

TITLE: Authenticating with Google Cloud SDK
DESCRIPTION: This snippet authenticates with the Google Cloud SDK and installs the Datastore Emulator, which are prerequisites for certain tests. This allows the developer to interact with Google Cloud services.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
gcloud auth login --update-adc
gcloud components install beta cloud-datastore-emulator
```

TITLE: Deploy Cloud Endpoints Configuration with gcloud
DESCRIPTION: This command deploys the Cloud Endpoints configuration for integration tests using the gcloud CLI. It specifies the API descriptor file (api_descriptor.pb), the service configuration file (api_config_test.yaml), and the Google Cloud project (oss-vdb). This ensures that the API endpoint is properly configured for testing purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/api/v1/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
gcloud endpoints services deploy api_descriptor.pb api_config_test.yaml --project=oss-vdb
```

TITLE: Running Local API Server Instance with Make
DESCRIPTION: This snippet authenticates with the Google Cloud SDK and then starts a local instance of the API server using `make`. This allows developers to test API changes locally.  Requires path to application default credentials.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
gcloud auth login --update-adc
make run-api-server
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running OSV-Scanner in License Summary Mode
DESCRIPTION: This command executes the OSV-Scanner with the experimental license summary flag to print a table with a package version count for each license found in the specified directory. This provides an overview of the licenses present in the project's dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/website/blog/content/posts/introducing-license-scanning-with-osv-scanner/index.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
osv-scanner --experimental-licenses-summary path/to/directory
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initialize Terraform
DESCRIPTION: This command initializes the Terraform working directory. It downloads the necessary provider plugins and sets up the backend to manage the infrastructure state. This command only needs to be run once to set up the terraform directory, though it is safe to run multiple times.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/deployment/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
terraform init
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking out Specific Git Commit
DESCRIPTION: Checks out a specific commit in a Git repository. This allows analysis of the project at a particular point in time, which is essential for identifying vulnerabilities present in that specific version of the codebase.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/website/blog/content/posts/introducing-broad-c-c++-support/index.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash

TITLE: Converting CVE to OSV
DESCRIPTION: This shell script clones the osv.dev repository, downloads a specific CVE in JSON format, and then runs the nvd-cve-osv conversion tool.  The script requires `git`, `go`, `gcloud`, and `cat` to be installed and configured.  It takes a CVE ID as input and produces an OSV entry JSON file in the specified output directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/vulnfeeds/cmd/nvd-cve-osv/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
CVE=CVE-2024-3094

git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/google/osv.dev

cd osv.dev/vulnfeeds

mkdir /tmp/nvd /tmp/nvd2osv

(cd test_data && ./download_specific_cves $CVE)
mv test_data/nvdcve-2.0/${CVE}.json /tmp/nvd
gcloud storage cp "gs://osv-test-cve-osv-conversion/cpe_repos/cpe_product_to_repo.json" "/tmp"

go run cmd/nvd-cve-osv/main.go \
    --cpe_repos "/tmp/cpe_product_to_repo.json" \
    --nvd_json "/tmp/nvd/${CVE}.json" \
    --out_dir "/tmp/nvd2osv"

cat /tmp/nvd2osv/*/*/${CVE}.json
```

TITLE: Version Comparison Edge Cases
DESCRIPTION: This snippet contains edge case tests for version comparison, focusing on handling build metadata (indicated by '#'). It showcases the specific rules and behaviors when comparing versions that have or lack build metadata extensions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/osv/ecosystems/testdata/packagist_test_cases.txt#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
1.2.3.# = 1.2.3
1.2.3.# = 1.2.3.#
1.2.3.# = 1.2.3.1
1.2.3.#.1 > 1.2.3
1.2.3.#.p3 > 1.2.3
1.2.3.#.beta < 1.2.3
```

TITLE: Cloning OSV Repository with Git
DESCRIPTION: This snippet clones the OSV.dev repository, including submodules, using Git and navigates to the cloned directory. It also displays suggested configurations for submodule management.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/google/osv.dev
# FYI
# git config fetch.recurseSubmodules on-demand
# is recommended to help manage updates to the osv/osv-schema submodule
cd osv.dev
poetry install
poetry self add poetry-plugin-shell
poetry shell
```

TITLE: Maven Dependency Declaration (XML)
DESCRIPTION: This XML snippet represents a Maven dependency declaration in a `pom.xml` file. It defines a direct dependency on `log4j-web` with a specific version. OSV-Scanner will identify any transitive vulnerabilities associated with this and other dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/gcp/website/blog/content/posts/announcing-transitive-dependency-support-for-maven-pomxml-in-osv-scanner/index.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.apache.logging.log4j</groupId>
    <artifactId>log4j-web</artifactId>
    <version>2.14.1</version>
</dependency>
```

TITLE: Applying Cloud Deploy Pipeline Configuration (gcloud)

LANGUAGE: Shell

```
gcloud deploy apply --file=clouddeploy.yaml --region=us-central1 --project=oss-vdb
```

TITLE: Download Debian Copyright Metadata (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This command downloads Debian copyright metadata, which is used to improve the accuracy of repository URL extraction. It mirrors the Debian copyright metadata from a specified URL.

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
wget \
  --directory debian_copyright \
    --mirror \
    -A unstable_copyright \
    -A index.html \
    https://metadata.ftp-master.debian.org/changelogs/main
```

```
}
```

TITLE: Downloading PyPI Vulnerabilities using gsutil
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to download all PyPI vulnerabilities from the OSV data dump using the `gsutil` command-line tool.  It uses the `cp` command to copy the `all.zip` file from the specified Google Cloud Storage (GCS) bucket to the current directory. Assumes `gsutil` is installed and configured.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/docs/data.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Or download over HTTP via https://osv-vulnerabilities.storage.googleapis.com/PyPI/all.zip
gsutil cp gs://osv-vulnerabilities/PyPI/all.zip .
```

TITLE: Pagination Request with Token (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to make a subsequent request for paginated results. The request specifies the `page_token` for the queries that returned a `next_page_token` in the previous response. Only the queries with tokens are included in the next request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/docs/api/post-v1-querybatch.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
cat <<EOF | curl -d @- "https://api.osv.dev/v1/querybatch"
{
  "queries": [
    {
      "package": {
        ...
      },
      "version": ...,
      "page_token": next_page_token from query 1,
    },
    {
      "package": {
        ...
      },
      "version": ...,
      "page_token": next_page_token from query 2,
    },
  ]
}
EOF
```

TITLE: Example 200 Response
DESCRIPTION: This is an example of a successful 200 response from the /v1experimental/importfindings/{source} endpoint. It returns a JSON object containing a list of 'invalid_records'. Each record includes the 'bug_id', 'source', a list of 'findings' describing the import issues, and timestamps for 'first_seen' and 'last_attempt'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/docs/api/get-v1-importfindings.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{"invalid_records":[{"bug_id":"EX-1234","source":"example","findings":["IMPORT_FINDING_TYPE_INVALID_JSON"],"first_seen":"2024-12-19T15:18:00.945105Z","last_attempt":"2024-12-19T15:18:00.945105Z"}]}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: GET Import Findings with curl
DESCRIPTION: This command uses curl to make a GET request to the /v1experimental/importfindings/{source} endpoint, retrieving import findings for the specified source. Replace 'example' with the desired source name as defined in source.yaml. The expected output is a JSON response containing invalid records and their associated findings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/docs/api/get-v1-importfindings.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl "https://api.osv.dev/v1experimental/importfindings/example"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Git Submodules
DESCRIPTION: This command initializes and updates all Git submodules within the repository. It's necessary for local building steps to work correctly, as some components rely on code from these submodules. The `--init` flag initializes any uninitialized submodules, and the `--recursive` flag updates submodules within submodules.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git submodule update --init --recursive
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Apply Kubernetes autoscaler configuration
DESCRIPTION: This command applies a Kubernetes configuration file to deploy the Stackdriver adapter for custom metrics autoscaling. It fetches the YAML file from a remote URL and applies it to the Kubernetes cluster. This sets up the necessary components for autoscaling based on custom metrics from Stackdriver.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/osv.dev/blob/master/deployment/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
kubectl apply -f https://raw.githubusercontent.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/k8s-stackdriver/master/custom-metrics-stackdriver-adapter/deploy/production/adapter_new_resource_model.yaml
```
